title: NASA’s Perseverance Rover Scientists Find Intriguing Mars Rock
summary: The six-wheeled geologist found a fascinating rock that has some indications it may have hosted microbial life billions of years ago, but further research is needed. A vein-filled rock is catching the eye of the science team of NASA’s Perseverance rover. Nicknamed “Cheyava Falls” by the team, the arrowhead-shaped rock contains fascinating traits that may […]

title: Akima lands $480 million Space Force contract to modernize Satellite Control Network
summary: The Satellite Control Network supports the launch, tracking, control, and maintenance of U.S. government satellites

title: How Europe’s biggest rocket came to be: Ariane 6 montage
summary: The first half of 2024 saw hundreds of people across Europe building, cajoling, shipping, lowering, integrating, securing and protecting the precious pieces and parts that came together to create Ariane 6 – Europe’s new heavy-lift rocket.

title: SpaceX successful in Falcon 9 static fire test
summary: SpaceX completed a successful Falcon 9 static fire test right as midnight struck on Thursday morning, marking a major step forward as...

title: Shannon Pallone, United States Space Force – Leading Women in Space
summary: In this episode of the SpaceNews Leading Women in Space series, correspondent Debra Werner speaks with Shannon Pallone, Program Executive Officer (PEO) for Battle Management Command, Control & Communications, Space Systems Command, U.S. Space Force.

title: Boeing’s crewed Starliner flight won’t return until at least August, NASA says
summary: Boeing’s crew spacecraft Starliner will stay docked with the International Space Station into August, NASA confirmed on Thursday, as the mission remains on hold while the company and agency study problems that arose early in the flight.

title: NASA, SpaceX Share Updates on ISS Deorbit Vehicle
summary: In a teleconference on July 17th, NASA and SpaceX provided additional information about the United States Deorbit Vehicle (USDV), the spacecraft which will be tasked with pushing the International Space Station out of orbit at the end of its lifetime.

title: Pete Beck vs. Chris Kemp: The rocket rivalry you’ve got to see to believe
summary: “I’m someone who wants to actually succeed from a business perspective."

title: NASA, Boeing provide update on the Starliner Crew Flight Test mission
summary: The update comes after NASA said it and Boeing completed ground hot fire testing of a reaction control system (RCS) to better understand some of the in-flight anomalies seen during the spacecraft's rendezvous and docking with the International Space Station.
